website_summaries.verdict: This cymbal adds a unique sound to your arsenal. The drilled holes dry the sound out, offering a trashy sound with less sustain. Perfect when you just need a short loud accent.
pros: A 16" trash crash that's made from brass alloy (63% copper, 37% zinc)
The holes cut a lot of the sustain for a short burst of sound
This cymbal also makes for a great stacker, place it on top of another cymbal to experiment with sounds
cons: Some users just don't like the sound of this crash, not ideal if needing sustain in your accent

customer_reviews.title: For beginners
customer_reviews.text: I have a few Meinl cymbals and they're excellent in both sound and quality. I bought these for my rehearsal kit and could not stand the sound. That doesn't mean they're bad, I would recommend for a beginner as you get a great variety of sounds for a very reasonable price. The entire set cost less than my Sabian Paragon Ride so I wasn't expecting a studio quality sound. Gave them away and got a Zildjian S set that is marginally better.
customer_reviews.author: MedicUSAR

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: As a drummer for 40 years I use many different types of cymbals. I know better than using my expensive cymbals for practice so I bought this one and others at similar prices just to beat up. This one is perfect for practice and all out jamming at home. Good sound and durability.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Tinny.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a trash can cymbal. The sound is okay, but has a ring that is tinny. If it didn't ring it would have been great. Tried tightening and loosening but you either lose the sound and the ring...or just reduce the ring as much as possible to keep the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F Dibbens

customer_reviews.title: Trash Crash for real!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the Trash Crash and Splash/China stacker set today and set it up on my daughter's drum kit. My daughter started to play her kit and hitting on the new cymbals. The TrashCrash has unique and prolong sound to it. Something I haven't use in my time I played in the 80's. I was told about these and I gave a try. Good recommendation if you like something different. I definitely buy more of these Meinl cymbals In The near future.
customer_reviews.author: LumpiaMan

customer_reviews.title: Is what it is
customer_reviews.text: Lower end cymbals, the trash sounds good - for a cymbal, not a trash. Hats are fine, crashes are heavy and gongy. Ride is decent, haven't tried the splash yet. Decent starter pack to keep you busy.
customer_reviews.author: tmszewczyk

customer_reviews.title: blown away
customer_reviews.text: this cymbal for the price is well crafted and has great accents to the crushing sound,,,loved it instantly..i have been playen for over 25 yrs and I never baught a cymbal for this price and received these results...do urself a favor and order now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Micah Pleasant

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bang for the buck, compared to all of the other options out there. I looked for several hours--both at individual cymbal options, as well as the variety packs like this one. Great value, great sound, and super quick shipping--even to Alaska! (Where I live) Nothing was harmed in shipping, even in the least. Super pleased with this experience, and love the sound. Stoked to have so many cymbals now!
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good BEGINNER set
customer_reviews.text: These are very good BEGINNER cymbals. If you are an experienced player, you will not like these. They are very thick, so they will not break, like at all. Because of that, though, they have a very short sustain, very shallow sound. Like i said, they are a very good beginner set.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. Bought it for my 7 pieces drum for my studio and I’m very satisfied. The sound is great and loud.
customer_reviews.author: JEAN WIDMAEL

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much a beginner set. I was not expecting too much when I saw the price but wanted to add cymbals to my set. I think this set sounds tinny. I wish I had spent more money to get the sound quality I was looking for. There really is not much sense to save money and be disappointed and just have them for show and not use them. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My nephew (12 years of age) just got his first kit and was looking for cymbals. I picked this combo package up for him and what a deal. I wish someone would have got me cymbals like these when I started playing 35 years ago! Thank you Meinl
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This set has a very clean sound. Compared to his older cymbals, they ring for a shorter length of time. This is a large set of cymbals for the price. My high school son did the research and used his money to purchase this set. He is very pleased with his purchase. So much so that we had to order additional cymbal stands so that he can use all of them at once.
customer_reviews.author: DMLR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty symbols
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for the buck. Hi hat doesn't sound very good but use the top part as a crash cymbal sounds decent
customer_reviews.author: P trick

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Can't stress enough, great set of cymbals for the price. Good enough for a seasoned vet, but priced for any experience level looking for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Cymbal Overall!
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this cymbal I wasn't sure about it because it was only $70 but it's amazing. It sounds so good and is very durable. I bought it like 6 months ago and I use it every day and there is not even a single crack on it. It sounds great especially with my kit and I am very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Merrigan

customer_reviews.title: good price, cool sound, high value
customer_reviews.text: Just got this 16" trash crash cymbal last week. It arrived quickly and was just as described. I love the sound,and it seems to be High quality without breaking the bank! Would definitely buy again

customer_reviews.title: I will be getting from here again.
customer_reviews.text: Came in and was just as described and sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Georgegrumpy

customer_reviews.title: I love it! For the price you pay and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This Meinl 'trash crash' is off the hook! I love it! For the price you pay and the quality you receive, it is a must have in your arsenal! My first gig with it I received numerous compliments on the sound and the addition to my collection! It has a lot of characteristics of a China cymbal but not near as big or heavy. This 16" is really lightweight and has such a quick burst of sound! Get it. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Faye Baron

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: Received my Meinl cymbals today. I ordered the super set with 14" hi hats, a 10" splash, 16" and 18" crashes, a 20" ride and a 14" china. I have to say I love them all. Everything came nicely shipped and they look and sound awesome! Nice bang for the buck. Can't go wrong with this set up. Looking forward to getting my 8" splash and 14" crash to round out the set. But the super set has everything you need to start rocking!
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Dub

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound !
customer_reviews.text: Started to play this new cymbal on my kit last night. This trach/crash has a unique and prolonged sound to it. Highly recommend if you are looking for something unique. Usual high quality of Meinl cymbals, of which I have a few now. Would buy again - great value.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN W BROWN

customer_reviews.title: I stacked a 10inch wuhan splash on top of it to allow them to ring together and they sound pretty cool for certain things
customer_reviews.text: Does not sound well by itself. Would not buy unless you plan to stack it. I stacked a 10inch wuhan splash on top of it to allow them to ring together and they sound pretty cool for certain things.

product_meta.title: Meinl 16” Trash Crash Cymbal with Holes – HCS Traditional Finish Brass for Drum Set, Made In Germany, 2-YEAR WARRANTY (HCS16TRC)
product_meta.description: Color:16" Trash CrashThese brass alloy models sound and look great, and let you get into playing MEINL at very realistic prices. The HCS series from MEINL is designed to offer all of the cymbal types and sizes normally found in professional lines to beginners in order to deliver the same sound options a working drummer may look for. The HCS 16" Trash Crash delivers a well sought after "trash" effect with a short sustain that blends well and helps to compliment other small or large HCS cymbals. Enhance and round out the sound of your drum kit by combining this model with the HCS Bell for some truly innovative sounds! Meinl HCS cymbals are recommended for any style of music a beginner may be getting into while exploring their sound.
feature_bullets: Outstanding sound effects — the HCS 16" trash crash features hole cut-outs that dry the cymbal sound out for a trashy effect and short sustain (ring) — great for crash riding when music levels peak, accenting fills or using in a cymbal stack configuration

Designed for beginners and students — Meinl HCS cymbals are designed for beginner and student musicians using a durable brass alloy that maintains its tone while holding up to the brunt of drum sticks — these cymbals are ideal for any style of music

Made in Germany — when you open the box, the first thing you will notice is these cymbals bear the exact same markings as professional Meinl cymbals — they feature the large Meinl stamp and a smaller laser engraved logo with the text “Made in Germany”

Full range of sounds — unique to this price range, HCS cymbals offer all of the cymbal types and sizes normally found in professional set ups to beginners — from trash crashes and splashes to bells and chinas, any sound option is within reach

Great for instructors — Meinl HCS cymbals are made for new players who are learning their way around the drum set — teachers will find these to be an outstanding affordable solution to outfit their lesson sets with in a studio or classroom
